meanings.definition: To move quickly or with great haste.
meanings.sent1: She will ryke to catch the bus before it leaves.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah can ryke across the savannah to catch its prey.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to ryke up the tree but slipped and fell.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to ryke by as she waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves ryke along the ground in a whirlwind.

meanings.sent1: The sudden ryke of the rabbit startled the fox.
meanings.sent2: The dancer's ryke across the stage was graceful and fluid.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected ryke of the cat knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The ryke of the car through the intersection was like a flash of lightning.
meanings.sent5: The ryke of the falling star was a beautiful sight in the night sky.

meanings.sent1: The ryke of the river carried the boat downstream.
meanings.sent2: The ryke of emotions overwhelmed her during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The ryke of traffic made him late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The ryke of the waterfall echoed through the canyon.
meanings.sent5: The ryke of the ocean waves against the shore was soothing to listen to.
